column4: Can anyone suggest an application to keep track of expenses? I need something a way simplier than GnuCash or HomeBank, as they are accounting application and offer a way more functionality than I need.
I repeat , doesn't OO have a balance sheet app ?
Maybe it does, but I want a standalone app.
I have ask the obvious, did you check the package manager ?
Maybe you had to, but that's rare case â€” for I did it.
Okay, I didn't tried just all of them, actually.
Doing that right now, thank you.
if you're familiar with the cli there's an application called ledger.
I am familiar with it, but do not want to use it in the everyday activity. I am trying dsBudget right now, looks good.
You gived up with that bot eventually?
ledger is listed in the package manager
I do think so, but I still do not want to use a CLI app on regular basis. They just aren't nice.
You know, after considering all options I think I'll stick to the GnuCash.
Why? It's not that complicated, it just contains a whole lot of accounting fearures I won't use.
I was being critical , I mean it.
When you want an application to be present in official repositories, to update on regular basis, have a good GTK interface, it isn't that much choice. Critical? It's was some unnoticable criricism.
